result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier S Fitzpatrick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court applied 9 days credit to cover court costs and will deem them paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier S Fitzpatrick

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant Xavier S Fitzpatrick in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Counts 1 & 3 are dismissed and readin. 

Court orders the following:
Count 2
- 28 days Jail w/ credit for 28 days. TIME SERVED 
- COSTS: $243.00 
- DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00  
- Court applies 9 days credit to cover court costs and will deem them paid in full. 

Defendant to be released forthwith.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:20 AM Defendant Xavier S Fitzpatrick in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Menden is asking for a plea/sentencing date.  The Court will set this matter for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
